commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What's the event Nozomi was talking about like anyway?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: We weren't planning on participating in an event this month, so we don't know anything about it.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Think about it now, I can't believe we agreed so readily without knowing anything.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I looked up the event after we agreed. It's an event aimed at students who do amateur music stuff.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: It's not just for school idols, but for music clubs, dance clubs, and people in all types of genres.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Really? Sounds fun.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: So it's like musical MMA? Cool!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I don't think they're going to have one-on-one battles.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: If we can enter this event, we'll be able to meet the other entrants, too. I'd love to talk to people about their thoughts on and enthusiasm for music.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Yeah, it could help us broaden our horizons as school idols.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: You two are so diligent.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Our club barely has any experience as school idols. In popularity, we already lose to μ's by a mile.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (But still, we tied with them in the nine contests. Everyone at Nijigasaki has more than enough potential.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (We have to take whatever chance we get so everyone can spread their wings on a bigger stage.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (It's my turn to do my best for them in order to make that happen.)

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm going to write a great song!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We'll beat μ's and earn the right to enter this event!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Do your best!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Looking forward to it.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Let's clutch this victory! I'm cheering for you!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Maki!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Hello.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Honoka? Kotori and Umi, too?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Maki, were you writing a song? We're not interrupting, are we?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: It's fine. What's up?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: *Chuckle* Considering we're in another competition with Nijigasaki, we want to know if we could help. We brought some snacks to refuel you!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: You're not allowed to eat in here.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: It'll be fine as long as you don't make a mess. Open up the windows and it won't even smell!

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Sorry. I tried to stop them.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: *Sigh* Well, as long as we don't get caught.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Huh? What's the door doing open. Hello?

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: Maki, we're here!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: How's the song writing going?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: We came to see how you were doing!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Wh-Why did all of you come?!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: We're all members of μ's here, so no need to be so crabby!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: That's right. We're going to help write this song. The songs you write are everyone's, after all!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: D-Do whatever you want.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: How far along is the song?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Here's how it is so far. I composed the entire song, but it doesn't seem right. I'm editing it now.

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: Ugh, reading music makes me dizzy. The notes look like little tadpoles.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Which part don't you like, Maki?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Umm, the fifth measure here.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: What does it sound like when you actually play it?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Great question! Maki, play it!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Ugh, fine. But you better give me some good ideas.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: We can make a good song, no doubt about it.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Is that your goal in all this?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: What are you talking about?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Don't play dumb. You only suggested a song-off so we'd finish the new song for the event.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: You noticed that the song wasn't really getting anywhere but you knew Maki wouldn't come asking for help of her own accord.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: So you used our contest with the Nijigasaki girls to put us in a situation where we could help her finish the song.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: You're thinking about this too much, Nico-chi. I just sympathized with how that girl from Nijigasaki felt.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I think a song that will make everyone listening happy would be better! Like bam bop bee doop do do!

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: I like an upbeat song, too. A jumping melody really gets your heart pumping.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: I think it'd be nice with a heavier theme, but of course with bright overtones.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: The song would end great with a big SHALALALA, right?

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: I don't know if it should be cute or cool...emotional would be nice, too!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Maki, why not change the final part? Something like this...

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Guys, don't talk all at once!
